Package controller

Class ModifyProductForm

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyProductForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductForm extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Class allowing user to alter values of existing products.

    • ModifyProductForm

      public ModifyProductForm()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Since part is being modified, all its existing data is filled into the text boxes. The user can then decide which fields need modification.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • onSaveProduct

      public void onSaveProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Overwrite existing product with new modified product. Will print error message to users if data entered is not acceptable.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onCancelProduct

      public void onCancelProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Returns user to main menu.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onRemoveAssociatedPart

      public void onRemoveAssociatedPart()
      Removes associated part from visual table, no part is actually removed from the product object until user saves changes to product. User is asked to press confirm before removing.

    • onAddAssociatedPart

      public void onAddAssociatedPart()
      Adds associated part to the visual table, no part is added to the product object until user saves product.

    • onSearchParts

      public void onSearchParts()
      Activated when user types in search box. Fills addPartTable with result of search. If search box is empty, table goes back to original state. Uses lookup function from the Inventory class.

    • returnToMain

      public void returnToMain​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Returns to main menu.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • populateFields

      public void populateFields()
      Adds associated part to the visual table, no part is added to the product object until user saves product.

    • loadAllParts

      public void loadAllParts()
      Loads all existing parts into the addPartsTable.
